title: Beethoven - Choral Fantasy Op. 80 - Ashkenazy
description:
More info on the Choral Fantasy including the words by the poet Christopher Kuffner and examples of the score at -
 <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Choral_Fantasy_(Beethoven)" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Choral_Fantasy_(Beethoven)</a>


This is my first Torrent and is a big thank you to all those in the Cloud who have helped me find the classical music that I now so enjoy.

I have not seen The Choral Fantasy as a torrent anywhere so I thought you guys might like to listen to it. Written in 1808 it is clearly the forerunner to the Ninth Symphony where the work was expanded altered and adapted by Beethoven into a symphonic form. This version by Vladimir Ashkenazy and The Cleveland Orchestra and Cleveland Orchestra Chorus dates from 1988.

This version is in Flac lossless and includes the CD box cover image. I use Media Monkey, which is free and allows you to incorporate the album art work, leaflets etc. Have a look at Media Monkey if you don't already use it.

I am unable to seed constantly so please allow for me being off-line from time to time until the seed has gone into a swarm.

Enjoy and keep the classical music coming! Share the world!

xxx

Due to popular interest I have been asked to add further info so here it is ---

Soprano - Mary Shearer
2nd Soprano - Teresa Cash
Alto - D'Anna Fortunato
Tenor - Jon Garrison
Baritone - Terry Cooke
2nd Baritone - Martin Horning
Chorus Director - Robert Page

The orchestra is conducted from the piano by Vladimir Ashkenazy himself.

The main theme of the Choral Fantasy was borrowed from 'Gegenlieb' a song set by Beethoven in 1795 which was at the time unpublished.

I have an extensive library so if you would like further classical works leave a comment here. Also, it would be interesting to here views from other music lovers so any comments would be nice (join Piratebay to enable comments - its free and anonymous).

Enjoy!
